creditline: Gift of Eric Brecher, Koplin Del Rio, and the 30 artists who participated in the production of this work of art
description: recto: black-and-white close-up portrait of a young woman with dark brown hair painted on small grids; girl is facing mostly forward, mouth closed, eyes looking off to PR; girl is wrapped in fuzzy blanket; focus/pixilation changes over grids verso: bricklike collage of variously sized rectangles with differing textures and motifs; many of the segments are covered in gold leaf or foil, while others are painted: incised tree ring pattern in gold foil ULC; panel with bubble wrap pattern in gold; trompe l'oeil satin fabric; painted ring or brooch, and billowing clouds; etching of eyes and bridge of nose in gold foil at C; wires and rooftops in negative image in gold leaf LRC
medium: Acrylic, gold leaf, foil, gold pigment and glitter on wood
text:
Tim Lowly explores the most intimate and profound experiences of being alive. Here he has depicted his father and mother and a moment of life transition. His father is on his deathbed and his mother is alone, immersed in nature after the event. Although Lowly based the images on photographs he took at separate times he felt they made sense together and spoke to the myriad feelings he and his family were experiencing in the wake of his father’s death.

At 25 was a collaborative work commemorating Lowly’s daughter Temma’s 25th birthday. She has been the subject of his work since birth and he has explored his relationship to her as caregiver and father. Temma was born with severe physical disabilities and the experience has been challenging and powerful for Lowly and his wife. He considers Temma a creative collaborator in his work and invited friends to contribute to this icon to her life.
title: At 25 (recto and verso)
